RESEARCH SCIENTIST

SUMMARY

Highly motivated Research Scientist possessing proficiency in numerous disciplines of the biotechnology and in-vitro diagnostic ( IVD ) industry.
Self starter •knowledgeable •analytical •decision maker •effective natural leader
Adaptable, Analytical, Dedicated, Driven, Effective, Focused, Hardworking, Highly motivated, Innovative Meticulous, Multi-task — oriented , Organized, Outstanding, Performance driven, Personable, Pragmatic, Proactive, Productive, Proficient, Skilled, Versatile
Highlights
EndNote, Softmax Pro, MS-Office Suite ( Excel, PowerPoint & Word ), C/C++, Windows & Mac OS.

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

To Discover and Characterize Epigenetic Modifications of Chromatin That Can Affect Organismal Lifespan (2012) Carried out reverse genetic screen to identify mutations in Histone H3 & H4 that might affect yeast growth in varying nutrient conditions.
Identified a histone acetyl transferase, SAS2 that modifies H3K14A under nutrient stress based on microarray analysis and protein expression studies using Western Blot analysis.
Molecular Characterization of Root Nodule Associated Bacteria (2011) Successfully isolated root nodule associated bacteria from naturally grown legumes.
Carried out molecular characterization through isolation of plasmid DNA & subsequent restriction enzyme analysis Mass Cultivation & Optimization of Biofuel Production by Using Microalgae (2011) Accomplished optimization of mass cultivation of microalgae.
Successfully carried out pilot scale studies of biofuel extraction from the microalgae & HPLC studies on the fuel.
Awarded 1st place for Paper presentation at BITS — Pilani , Dubai Annual Technical Conference-2010 Awarded 2nd place for Poster presentation at the Engineering Student Renewable Energy Competition-2011 Isolation & Characterization of Bacterial Strains for Bioremediation of Soil Contaminated with Oil Spills (2009) Successfully isolated bacterial strains from soil contaminated with oil spills.
Achieved degradation of various hydrocarbon sources which was monitored using UV/Visible Spectroscopy.
Awarded 1st place at the BITS — Pilani , Dubai Annual Technical Conference - 2009 SKILLS Interpersonal skills: Effective communicator, quick learner and adaptable.
Effective leader Integral part of the organizing committee for events by Chimera Biotechnology Club - BITS Pilani Dubai Communication Key communication point to management for current project at Saladax Biomedical,Inc.
Give presentations and lead team discussions on a regular basis as a Research Scientist at Saladax Biomedical, Inc.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Agriculture Field Manager

Location: Oregon, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Production, Supply Chain

Description:
Core Botanica, part of Martin Bauer Group nature network, offers high quality, sustainably grown mint leaf products sourced and manufactured in the Pacific Northwest and we are seeking a dedicated Field Manager to join our team in Terrebonne, Central Oregon.
If you have a background in agriculture and possess strong leadership skills, we want to hear from you!
Your primary responsibility will be to partner and develop grower relationships in the Pacific Northwest through your deep passion and expertise for the farms, their families, and our communities.
This role is onsite in Terrebonne, Oregon. Monthly travel will be required to the Pacific Northwest Farms for monitoring growth, quality, production, grower relationships, and training.
Grower Relations Develop and maintain a quality grower base in multiple regionsPrepare and sign annual production contracts with growers to adequately fulfill sales demandsAct as the first point of contact for growers for all questionsDevelop strong lines of communication with each grower specific to their operation including key employees/family members. Utilize preferred methods to keep in regular contact throughout the year.Incorporate regular training of growers and key employees regarding CORE’s Environmental program covering key topics, including safety, purity, and sustainability.
Field Work and RecordkeepingMaintain CORE’s field recordkeeping system to verify and record all significant production activities by grower and field.Create and record detailed field information into the system monthly through the growing season for each contracted production field to ensure traceability to source of all CORE productsOversee field production operationsMonitor weed, insect, and disease levels along with overall crop quality throughout the yearManager and direct all pesticide and IPM applications and strategiesDevelop and maintain strong relationships with regional chemical & fertilizer suppliersAccess chemical labels and details relating to rates, timing, weed lists, etc.Take lead role in pre-harvest sampling and residue testing requests of all raw materialsCustomer Relations –Develop relationships and open dialog with supply chain managers and field agronomistsAssist with annual customer tours involving visits to growing regions, fields, growers, research projects, plots, points of interest, etc.Manage customer field record systems as requested. Take lead role in compliance with specific field management requirements and field auditsInvestigate and provide background information with customers inquiries related to the quality of raw productsUnderstand and quickly access EU and US pesticide residue tolerance websitesIdentify and take lead role in managing specific customer concerns regarding residues, toxic weeds, health risks, etc.
Research and Development Identify new products, crops, processes, equipment and help develop strategies to determine potential value, efficiency, and feasibilityAssist with strategic crop development program and set up local trial plotsDevelop and lead in building field related prototype equipment, processes, and methods that move good ideas into commercial productionWork with customers in confidential product and variety development projectsTest new chemical products and rates by setting up plots, recording application data/efficacy, and testing for residueWork with customers to improve, modify, expand current pesticide application program in order` to address current field issuesRecord and report R&D time and expensesVolume/Inventory Management Assist with strategic volume planningSecure contracted production to fulfill sales/customer needsAssist in lot selection to fill specific needs and production scheduleCreate and regularly update yield projections by product type, grower, field
Qualifications:Four-year degree in a related major preferred but not required in lieu of direct experienceAt least 5 years progressive experience working with full life cycle of crops and demonstrated strategic management of irrigated cropsDemonstrate strong work ethic, outstanding leadership ability and exceptional interpersonal skillsExperience in a leadership role and direct involvement on the business side of the industry Self-directed individual who leads projects to identify and implement solutions with team inputAbility to acquire and hold a valid US driver’s license and successfully pass vehicle insurance verification Superior organizational and project management skills and experience leading and managing people.Proficient in the use of Windows based computer programs (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams) and a general aptitude with software systems.Must hold or immediately obtain upon hire Commercial Applicator’s license or Consultant’s license
Preferred qualificationsMechanical/fabrication skillsClass A commercial license/current DOT medical cardBi-lingual English/Spanish


Physical Requirements Ability to continuously work outdoors all day in various and sometimes extreme weather conditions. Ability to continuously work with product and equipment at ground level. Ability to work on uneven terrain both on foot and while aboard moving equipment. Ability to get on and off various stationary and moving equipment. Must wear corrective lenses if required/listed on driver’s license. Must be able to move items weighing up to 75 lbs.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
